author: {'steamid': '76561197969417125', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 378, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1585093822}
review:
Quarantine is a turn based strategy game where the player is tasked with protecting the world from a deadly virus. The core gameplay is reasonably enjoyable, but unfortunately there’s a serious lack of depth. I'm giving a positive recommendation because, although you'll probably only get a few hours entertainment from the game (I’m done with it after 6 hours), the purchase price is low, so it still represents value for money.

[b]Gameplay[/b]

At the start of each turn, the virus will infect more people and spread to more cities around the world. The player can then use their team to perform a few actions.
-	Scientists specialise in gathering samples which can be used to research a cure, and this is how you win the game.
-	Medics specialise in treating the infected, which reduces the global infection meter. If this gets too high, its game over.
-	Security officers specialise in quarantining cities, which slows the spread of the virus.
-	Diplomats specialise in setting up offices, which generates income. Money is used to hire new team members (up to a maximum of 5), establish quarantines, and deal with scenarios.

Scenarios happen at random times and are presented as a paragraph of text describing how civilians/businessmen/celebrities are doing something stupid, causing the virus to spread. You’ll usually get two or three options for how to deal with it, which have a % chance to succeed or fail. Success mainly results in a reduction of infection, or an increase in quarantine, whilst failure increases the infection.

There's also a tech tree, allowing you to research upgrades that either increase the effectiveness of your team, or slow down the virus in various ways.
 
[b]Lack of depth[/b]
 
There are five different viruses, but they all seem to function pretty much the same. I haven't been forced to use significantly different tactics against each virus. Each virus only takes around 30-45 minutes to beat.

There aren’t many different scenarios. I started encountering repeats as early as my second game. And assuming you have enough money, you might as well just pick whatever option has the best chance to succeed. There doesn’t seem to be any options that are high risk / high reward. Money is only a problem in the first few turns while you’re saving up for new team members. 
 
I also think that the endgame could have been expanded. If the whole world is infected, I don’t think it makes sense that developing the cure results in an instant victory. It would surely take a few turns to mass produce and distribute, during which time more bad things could happen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402278416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1504528689}
review:
相比瘟疫公司，游戏元素太少。瘟疫的扩散次数是每回合固定的，与感染瘟疫的人数和分布无关，国家、地区间没有差异性，胜利条件单一且简单，只要在实验室研究所有的基因片段即可

建议 丰富游戏元素，加强瘟疫突变率，加强瘟疫威力，相应的增加抗瘟疫手段

author: {'steamid': '76561198097624528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1504301478}
review:
Mediocre sotto molti aspetti. non c'è reale differenza tra un tipo di pandemia e l'altra solo la velocità con cui si "espande"
trovo il grado di sfida molto sbilanciato.

in particolare il fatto che non si possa scegliere, come Quartier generale iniziale, una qualsiasi città ma solo 4 dislocate pure male; le citta sono San Francisco, Londra, Cairo e Tokio. quindi se il grosso dell'epidemia sta nel sud Africa minimo due turni li perdi per spostarti.

Non si ha mai la necessità di sbloccare tutte le abilità, perchè o vinci velocemente o perdi senza speranza in massimo 18 turni (che sono giorni)

i turni... in plague inc (gioco a cui Quarantine fa l'alterego, cosa che non mi dispiace) passano anni all'interno gioco per permettere alla malattia di diffondersi, qui in 18 turni(giorni) mezzo continente è infettato

le condizioni di sconfitta sono assurde, se il levello di contaggio raggiunge 60 ai perso, anche se la malattia ha contaggiato solo il sud america o un solo continente. (hai perso l'umanità è destinata all'estinzione... eh!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052737716', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1504172891}
review:
Помня Plague, я ожидал от игры чего-то похожего, но с другой стороны баррикад.
К сожалению, Карантин не похож на Плагью и не похож на стратегию. Геймплей напоминает настольную игру для 8vs1 человек, но в которую играют двое - за врачей и за болезнь. Соответственно скоро становится скучно.
Я терпеливый человек, но меня хватило только на 21 минуту игры, совершенно не интересно.
Запросил возврат.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323092691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1503677505}
review:
用了一个多小时通关了三个关卡，剩下的不想玩了。

这款游戏一开始确实很吸引人，毕竟和瘟疫公司是相反的题材，这个创意确实很好，但是游戏本身问题太多，所以我也只能先给个差评


＊游戏难度太低
说实话通关游戏感觉一点挑战性都没有，完全没有瘟疫公司的那种紧张感。外交官几乎没有什么用，医师只会自奶作用也不大，各项活动的成本都一般，到了后期基本不缺钱，隔离也是很BUG的存在，只要把感染地区隔离起来就无敌了，只需要不停刷回合数赶紧结束游戏就可以了，突发事件出现几率也很一般，而且事件成功率都比较高，失败的损失也不大。所以希望可以适当加大资金消耗，比如说特工移动出行也要钱（坐飞机不要钱么？）开发研究科技也要钱，或者适当地降低收入，另外收入来源也非常单一，希望可以让收入更加多元化，比如可以考虑加入制药卖药系统之类的。总之就是要加大难度，给玩家一点压迫感，还可以让特工偶尔闹闹情绪之类的

＊游戏内容单一
游戏玩来玩去都是那几个套路，玩久了就感觉很无聊，可以适当加入更多内容。包括更多更频繁的随机事件，以及各国各个政府的态度以及作为，毕竟整个游戏感觉玩家扮演的更像是总统老大了，干什么事情除了疾病就没有别的对手了，但是事实上如果真的发生这种大规模疾病肯定是不会所有人都乖乖配合的，所以可以让政府国家在游戏过程中多插几脚，让外交专家不要那么没用。还建议可以让专家更加真实，比如每个专家有自己的特性性格面对危险有不同的态度等等。游戏配乐也很单一，希望可以创造出更多配乐，或者是更多的人物独白等等。实在不行也可以借鉴一下瘟疫公司关于每种病状的描述，这些描述虽然感觉没什么用，但是看起来就感觉逼格很高，而且总会有人好奇花掉一些时间去看那些介绍。此外每种病原体的特点不够突出，可以赋予他们更多的特点然他们玩起来和别的病原体不一样（当然还是要考虑到实际情况），也可以脑洞大开搞点丧尸病毒啥的也没问题。


总的来说我还是很看好这款游戏的，以上是一些建议，毕竟看评论了解到游戏工作室还是比较用心的，更新速度快对玩家也比较重视。所以希望可以尽快更新，完善游戏内容。到时候我会再把评论改成好评。

author: {'steamid': '76561197977033511', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1552688734}
review:
Well, can't say it is too much of a thing, at a low price tag, it was fun for the first dozen of hours, but not much of replay value.
Since they call that out of early access, doesn't looks like it will get much new content anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973112890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1476, 'last_played': 1709858084}
review:
It can get very repetitive, very simplistic (like, way so overly simplistic it's almost like the devs made it on purpose from some agenda of saying we need more funding I can't even win it without starting someone to get me more money). It has few scenarios. Hell, this is one of few I would actually buy DLCs from.

That being stated, the very fact I would even be willing and wanting DLC says something excellent about this game. I think they should add a bit more, but otherwise this is a fantastic game that I would highly recommend. If you liked Plague or Pandemic you'll love this one. It really is a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002694555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1526297502}
review:
全シナリオ（ハード）クリア済み

[h1] "The 隔離"ゲー	[/h1]
「キュア」を見つけるまで、ひたすら都市を「隔離」しまくって病原体から世界を救え！！


「Quarantine（隔離）」は、病原体の拡散・拡大を阻止しながら、「キュア」の発見を目指すターンベースストラテジーゲームだ。
１ゲームは３０分前後で終了するようなゲームデザインになっていると思われる。
スマホではリリースしてないようだが、スマホでの操作にも適しているようなプレイフィールだと感じた。

ストアページの画像は早期アクセスのものなのか、現在の正式版と若干ＵＩが異なっている。
またストアページには未表記だが、クラウドに対応している。（2017年7月現在）

[h1] 【英語わからないんだけど…】	[/h1]
日本語はないが、ゲームを理解して楽しむにはキャッチコピーの「FIND THE CURE, SAVE THE WORLD」程度が読めれば充分！

[h1] 【ゲームの目的】	[/h1]
勝利：ラボで「キュア」を開発する。（「変異」により研究過程が増加）
　　　もしくは治療で全都市から病原体を根絶する。（医療班で治療可能）
敗北：一定数の世界人口が病原体に感染する。

病原体と難易度、初期チームを選択するとゲームスタート。
ロンドンやカイロ、東京といった都市の中から１つを選択すると、ＨＱが設置される。病原体は一部シナリオを除きランダムで最初の感染都市が決定される。
病原体はターン開始時に、未感染都市への拡散と、感染都市での拡大を行うので、ＨＱまたは設置したオフィスから「チーム」を派遣し、「感染治療―サンプル収集―オフィス設立―Quarantine（隔離）」のオペレーションを指示して、病原体の拡散・拡大を阻止しつつ、病原体一掃のための「キュア」発見を目指す。
ＨＱとオフィスから毎ターン得られる収入は、新たな「チーム」を雇用したり、「研究」や「技術」開発を早めたり、ランダムイベントを解決するのに使われる。

要約すると「Quarantine（隔離）」は、
―感染者を治療しながら、（敗北条件を遅らせる）
―隔離で拡散・拡大を防ぎつつ、（敗北条件を遅らせる）
―サンプルを収集して「キュア」を開発、（勝利条件を達成する）
―もしくは病原体を治療で根絶するゲームである。（勝利条件を達成する）

[h1] 【病原体とチーム】	[/h1]
病原体は「シナリオ」という形で表現される。
バクテリアやプリオン、エボラなどがあるが、[url=store.steampowered.com/app/246620] Plague Inc [/url]と異なり、乾燥地帯に強いとか船舶で拡散といった、地理学的な性質は持たない。
各都市も同様で、経路も都市という「ノード」を繋ぐためのもののみの役割に留まっている。
この点はシンプルすぎるというか、若干物足りなく感じた点だ。

病原体は「未感染都市への拡散率」、「感染都市での拡大率」、「変異速度」と病原体が個別に持つ「特性」で差別化される。

これらの病原体に対抗するため、プレイヤーは専門分野がそれぞれ異なる「チーム」を雇用して配置することができる。
スタート時に無償で雇用する「チーム」は移動力が高く、それぞれに対応した初期「技術」が開発済みとなる。
オペレーションをこなすことで「チーム」はレベルアップし、追加ボーナスを得る。

治安部隊：「Quarantine（隔離）」にボーナス。隔離都市における拡散と拡大を無効化する。
医療班：感染都市における治療行為にボーナス。感染者を直に減らすことができる。
外交団：オフィスを割安で設立できる。オフィスを建て終わったら多分解雇される。
科学班：感染都市でサンプル収集にボーナス。サンプルは「キュア」の研究に必要。

[h1] 【４つの技術ツリー】	[/h1]
技術ツリーなどと書くと、Civのようなものを想像するかもしれないが、４×４＝１６のみとなっている。
セキュリティーツリーなら〔オペレーション時に失う体力の減少〕や〔隔離＋１〕、サイエンスツリーなら〔病原体が変異に必要なポイントを増加させる〕や〔感染治療時に都市の感染者が０の場合、病原体が都市で再拡大できなくなる〕などそれぞれカテゴリーに応じた内容となっているので、プレイスタイルに併せた取得が望ましい。
全１６個は少ないと感じるかもしれないが、いずれの効果もユニークであり、通常のプレイであれば、８個前後の取得で勝利か敗北が決定しているので、少ないとは感じなかった。


[h1] 【キュアの位置づけとMutation（変異）】	[/h1]
このゲームで面白いのが病原体に対する「キュア」の位置づけだ。
実は「感染した人口」は医療班で治療することができる。上手く「隔離」して「治療」できれば「キュア」の完成を待たずに勝利することも可能だ。
なのでこのゲームにおける「キュア」とは、病原体を世界から一掃するための治療法ないし治療薬となる。

そのため「キュア」の発見には、ラボで病原体の「特性」を研究し理解することが必要となる。
各病原体は元々の性質に加え、「感染拡散＋１」や「変異閾値減少＋１０％」といった特性を備えている。
これらの「特性」の研究を終えると、その「特性」は無効可され、全「特性」の無効可により「キュア」の完成となる。

しかし、病原体は変異ポイントが貯まると新たな「特性」を獲得して、「キュア」への道のりが一歩遠のいてしまうので、ゆっくり足元を固めてからといったプレイスタイルにはリスクも伴う。


[h1] 【おススメだけど…】	[/h1]
個人的に自信を持っておススメですか？に「はい」と言えるタイトルである。
それはとてもシンプルなルールで手にした瞬間、つまりこのゲームをプレイして直ぐにシステムの全容がすんなり理解でき、プレイして間もなく、システムを完全に理解してプレイを楽しめたことにある。いわゆる「 easy to play 」という点だ。
きっと直接プレイして貰えれば、上の長い文章を読むより早くゲームシステムを理解できると思う。

ただこのゲームは非常に優れた「 easy to play 」であったが故に、「 learn to hard 」足りえなかった点に物足りなさを感じた。
ラッシュにしろタートルにしろ、基本的には最初の７～８ターン程で、「キュア」完成が世界感染より早いかどうか、感染を抑え込めるかどうかの目途がついてしまうし、その道のりもある程度限られているからだ。難易度をあげてもそれは変わらない。

また、タイトルにもなっている「Quarantine（隔離）」のオペレーションが非常に強力な点もどうかと思う。Lv3の治安部隊とサイエンスツリーの強化隔離の組み合わせで、１アクションで４回も拡散と拡大を阻止できるのは「縛りプレイ」も頭をよぎるほどだ。（縛り実績有り）

とはいえ、この「Quarantine（隔離）」が面白かったゲームなことは確かなので、今後はワークショップで世界が真っ赤になるまでどれだけ耐えられるかといった「エンドレス」モード（今は一定数の感染で終了）や、都市ごとに異なった人口（今は一律同じ）や隔離オペのnerfといったModを誰か職人さんが作ってくれるんじゃないかという淡い期待を抱きつつ、「Quarantine（隔離）」の今後の発展を期待したい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198004316343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1498822734}
review:
This is a pretty solid adaptation of the Pandemic game style. Simple, reasonably fun to play, but unfortunately also meanders after the third game. It quickly becomes a game of control nodes, rather than strategy, tactics without suprise. It has some great underlying concepts; the disease research centres, the unlocks, but it feels... bereft of further content. I want to like this game, I'd even be willing to go back and play it after a break, but it simply needs more complexity. Airborne strains/waterborne strains introduce new challenges to contain the contagion would be a simple thought. The virus mutates or somehow breaks containment- and now you have to react. World events are a fantastic addition to this game and could easily make this more modifier heavy. Or hell; two pathogens at once.

Solid game; too simple to be distinguished among others of its kind- but it had/has the potential to be. Maybe wait for DLC/Updates. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198090886253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1492330740}
review:
机制类似瘟疫公司，怎么看都是一个手游。抢先体验48，正式上线36，但不管48还是36，这样的价格都不推荐。
5-10元的话可以玩玩，目前这个价格还是算了。
看着购买历史，我觉得自己他妈宛如一个智障。

author: {'steamid': '76561198031630752', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1498067305}
review:
Das Spiel ist jetzt keine Weltrevolution aber wer Plague Inc. mochte wird Quarantine auch mögen behaupte ich mal.

Es ist relativ leicht zu erlernen aber bietet auch nur wenige Möglichkeiten gegen die Krankheiten vorzugehen. Grundsätzlich gibt es zwei Taktiken von denen eine immer aufgeht: Entweder man versucht sehr schnell eine Heilung zu finden oder man dämmt die Verbreitung mit Quarantäne Zonen und Sanitätern ein. 

In maximal einer Stunde hat man dann auch die fünf Szenarien durch und kann dann selbst Szenarien erstellen oder den Workshop nutzen oder noch besser sich selbst Ohrfeigen weil man gerade 10€ für eine Stunde Unterhaltung ausgegeben hat....Ja die dritte Option ist wirklich die Beste.

Aber jetzt mal ganz ehrlich: WHAT. THE. FUCK.? Haben die Entwickler keine Ideen gehabt oder kein Budget um wenigstens ein bisschen Umfang unterzubekommen? Wenn kein Budget vorhanden war warum dann Early Access?
Selbst bei vielen 0,99€ Apps für Android/iOS bekommt man da mehr geboten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071357985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 64, 'playtime_at_review': 1426, 'last_played': 1711291976}
review:
I am really enjoying this game. It's an excellent turn based strategy that unlike so many games, has you working to save the world instead of just killing stuff. It feels very much like a multiplayer board game where you're in control of all the players. I think it would be very kid friendly too, since no disease effects are particularly graphic, and there's almost no sense of violence.

Since leaving early access, there has still been devlopment, both in the workshop and to the base game. They just put out a balancing patch that I think helped make lesser used classes much more relevant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131951391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1495784214}
review:
I recommend this game, however I didn't really enjoy it. The concept is great, but my main issues are as follows.
1) Clicking a button after you send someone to do a task seems pointless and annoying. I want to treat one city, and go straight to treat the next with another working, I don't want to have to acknowledge that i've made a move, a simple voice 'task complete' would be great.
2) End of game is achieved when you research all the strains. The last strain took 4 days, which makes me feel the last 4 moves to the pointless. The dieases was only at 20/60, 4 moves of not treating any city would have still had me win the game. If the game is going to operate this way then it should know that i'm researching the last strain, the virus won't overtake the world in 4 days, and I should instantly win. A lot of people have referred to this as a reverse Plague Inc, and that's because it is (and Plague Inc is an amazing game). What makes it good till the every end is when when the cure is developing (which varies in speed based on how bad the virus is), you still have a chance to distroy the world, you can mutate the virus and research immunity to antibiotics to set back and slow the cure. Surely this game could implement a strategy that even once the cure is researched it's not an instant win, the tables can still be turned. Granted I was playing this on easy, but I was disappointed at the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012233925', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1495738305}
review:
Выйди игра, до появления Plague Inc, она бы превнесла что новое и необычное.
А в данной ситуации, это очень урезанная, с минимум вариаций, с присутствием всего лишь 4 сценариев игра.
Данная игра, это как появление на свет GTA2, но после того как уже пару лет выпущена GTA5.
Запросил возврат средств.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027469892', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1495715544}
review:
Spielbeschreibung: 
Bei Quarantine handelt es sich um ein rundenbasiertes Strategiespiel, in dem man die finanziellen Ressourcen und die Aktionen seiner bis zu 5 Agenten verwaltet um eine die Weltbevölkerung bedrohende Seuche zu bekämpfen.

Hierzu bewegt man jede Runde seine Agenten zwischen verschiedenen Städten auf der Weltkarte um Patienten zu behandeln, Städte unter Quarantäne zu stellen, Proben zu sammeln oder Forschungszentralen (generieren zusätzliches Einkommen) zu errichten. Zusätzlich kann man gegen Geld Verbesserungen für seine Agenten erforschen und, mit genügenden Proben, Teile eines Heilmittels zu entdecken.

Die Krankheit hat je nach gewähltem Szenario unterschiedliche Parameter, die Mutationsrate, Verbreitungsgeschwindigkeit, usw. beeinflussen. Am Ende jeder Runde breitet sie sich in weitere Städte aus oder intensiviert sich in bereits infizierten Städte. Erreicht die Krankheit in einer Stadt Intensitätsstufe 4, gilt diese Stadt als verloren und kann nicht mehr betreten werden.

Der Spieler gewinnt, wenn ein Heilmittel entdeckt wird oder die Krankheit ausgerottet wird. Das Spiel ist verloren, wenn zu viele Menschen an der Krankheit erkranken.

 Urteil: 
Quarantine gleicht in Präsentation und Spielverlauf einem Brettspiel. Die Agenten werden auf dem Spielfeld versetzt, man wählt eine Aktion für den Agenten, wählt gegebenenfalls ein Forschungsziel und beobachtet dann den Zug der Krankheit. Dabei ist die Benutzeroberfläche und das generelle Art-Design sehr schön und ansprechend ausgearbeitet.

Dabei mangelt es meiner Meinung nach an strategischer Tiefe:
[list]
    [*]Agenten unterscheiden sich nur in den Erfolgswahrscheinlichkeiten (Auch ein Sicherheitsbeamter kann Patienten behandeln)
    [*]Jedes Szenario lässt sich mit der gleichen Stategie lösen
    [*]Ein Spiel dauert maximal 25 Runden
    [*]Aktuell gerade einmal 4 Szenarien, die sich alle gleich spielen
[/list]
Aufgrund dieses Mangels an Spieltiefe ist der Wiederspielwert sehr gering.

Während der 3,5 Monate langen Early Access Phase wurde dieses Problem kaum angegangen. Lediglich die Einführung von Bewegungsreichweiten der Agenten machte Quarantine herausfordernder.

Auch ansonsten geschah während der Early Access Phase nicht viel:
list]
    [*]Einige Bugfixes
    [*]Verbesserungen der Benutzeroberfläche
    [*]Lokalisierungen
    [*]Ein neues Szenario
[/list]

Meines Erachtens nach eignet sich dieses Spiel eher für kurze Spielrunden auf dem Tablet, vorallem da man nach 5-10 Stunden alle Szenarien und Herausforderungen gemeistert hat. 

Aufgrund des Mangels an strategischer Tiefe und des geringen Wiederspielwerts, kann ich Quarantine nicht empfehlen.


PS: Ich finde es eine Unverschämtheit den regulären Preis des Spiels nach Beendigung der Early Access-Phase um 33% zu senken. Nachdem man den Entwicklern Vertrauen vorgeschossen hat und sich über die Foren und Umfragen an einer potentiellen Verbesserung des Spiels beteiligt hat fühlt man sich danach ein wenig betrogen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960493700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1495711744}
review:
日本語未対応ですが、ボードゲーム「パンデミック」を知っている人なら、
翻訳サイト片手になんとなく感覚だけでプレイできるのではないでしょうか。
いうほど難しい英単語はないのと、日本語化は簡単そうな作りにみえます。
（自分が特に困っていないからと他力本願）

・勝利条件はCUREが完了
・敗北条件は全都市の感染

一時しのぎとはいえ、各都市を回って感染予防措置を取ったり、突然変異を予防するのも大事。
お金を使ってチームを雇ったり、研究やスキルを向上させるのも重要。
お金をより集めるためにオフィスを立てるのも重要。
といった具合に、ストラテジー要素を楽しめます。ストラテジーというほど難しくはないですが。

要は生産（オフィス）、テクノロジーの研究、戦闘（感染予防措置）　といったとこでしょうか。
これらをバランスよく、CUREが完了するまで維持・継続するのが目的です。

ボードゲームでおなじみの、突発的なパンデミックイベントも発生する為、
お金のやりくりをギリギリで回していると高難易度だと詰むことも稀にあります。
ボドゲが好きな人なら楽しめるんじゃないでしょうか。
ボリュームは普通というか若干少ない気がしますが、ワークショップ対応のようですので
ユーザー作成シナリオが増えることに期待しています。

author: {'steamid': '76561198034072369', 'num_games_owned': 13581, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1493652960}
review:
[h1] Quarantine [/h1]

DISCLAIMER: I received this product for no cost for the purpose of reviewing. However, this does not affect my views and opinions of the game.

Quarantine is a turn-based, strategy, simulation game. The title was developed by Sproing and published by 505 Games. The game plays similarly to the board game; "Pandemic" and even shares the same theme. The player takes control of the director of Pandemic Defence; an international bio-security agency tasked with taking on pathogens across the world. 
--------

[b] Graphics: 7 / 10 [/b] 

The graphical assets of the game are well done. The character portraits as well as the random event cards look great, and the 2D art-style of the game is very reminiscent to that of a board game. That being said, this also means that there are little to no animations or effects, and although the art is nice, there isn't a whole lot of it within the game. The title should run fine on any low - mid-tier GPU and CPU as it is not that demanding. 

--------

[b] Sound: 6 / 10 [/b] 

The sound assets of the game are pretty well done. The in-game music gives a great sense of urgency to the game-play, and is very fitting for the game's theme. There is some minor voice acting within the game that is surprisingly well done. The sound assets do unfortunately suffer from the same issue as the graphics; there just isn't enough of it. 

--------

[b] Mechanics: 7 / 10 [/b]

The title has a good set of core game-play mechanics, but lacks some depth. Although the game is solid, it feels as though there should be more to it. 

The game is played in scenarios. The player will choose their scene and difficulty as well as their starting area and unit. The objective of the game to stop and contain the outbreak of a disease. To do this, the player will be able to hire agents that can; quarantine cities to prevent the spread of the disease, heal and reduce the infection meter of a city, build offices in cities that generate income, and collect samples from a pathogen to help with research. Each unit has it's own speciality which give bonuses to performing certain tasks. These units can also level up to better perform their actions, but can also take damage when performing said actions. Units can only take one action per turn and have a predetermined set of movements and hit points that is shown when hiring them. 

The rate at which the disease spreads and grows is dependant on the type of pathogen and difficulty chosen at the beginning of the scenario. Diseases can move from city to city. The game is over once the disease takes over enough of the map or if the player is able research or find a cure. A cure can be found by collecting enough samples and using them to create antibodies. 

The game can become quite hectic quickly if the pathogen spreads too much and the player's units can not keep up with it. There's a lot of strategy involved with unit placement and in which areas to quarantine. There is a skill tree that consists of upgrades that can aid the player, though these take time to research and also carry a lot of thought in which enhancements to research at which times. 

--------

[b] Final Personal Remarks: [/b]

The game has very good core mechanics, and very much reminds me of the "Pandemic" board game series. Unfortunately, with just the core mechanics, the game feels a bit lacking. There are random events that can happen to spice things up a little bit while playing, otherwise it's a very straight forward title. I am aware that the title is in early access and that the devs plan on releasing a lot more scenarios and content for the game. I do believe that the game has a lot of potential and plenty of room to grow. It's just at the moment, there isn't a whole lot of depth to the game. All the scenarios can be completed in about two or three hours. 

The main difference between the table top game; "Pandemic" and this digital title is that; Quarantine is a single player title. The game gets a lot more hectic with other people involved. Communicating with others and combining a team's effort, is what makes the board game a lot of fun. If multiplayer was implemented into this title, I'm sure it would make the game a lot more interesting. 

Thanks to [url=www.saveorquit.com] SaveOrQuit [/url] for giving me the opportunity to review the title, as well as anyone who took this review into consideration, I hope it helped.

review: 游戏类似于《瘟疫公司》，但这个游戏恰恰相反，玩家不是扩张而是防御，需要在阻止病毒扩散的同时研究出解药。我很喜欢这个题材，但是游戏目前的内容较少，玩家体会不到那种惊心动魄的感觉，事件上也需要增强，总的来说，该游戏的游戏性是有的，但是还有很大的发展空间。

author: {'steamid': '76561198020955773', 'num_games_owned': 1866, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1492897642}
review:
W stosunku do "Plaque Inc" tutaj walczymy z epidemią. 

Możemy prowadzić badania, zatrudniać 4 rodzaje specjalistów, budować bazy w miastach czy ogłaszać kwarantanny. Tylko co z tego: świat jest mały, bazy służą jedynie do generowania dochodu, badania są szczątkowe i ciagle miałem wrażenie jakbym grał w jakąś grę planszową. Rozgrywka toczy się w turach w których przydzielamy badania nad wirusem i nad metodami leczenia, a także wydajemy rozkazy swoim pracownikom.

Mamy 4 rodzaje badań w 4 kategoriach leczniczych. Do każdej kategorii musimy zebrać próbki, możemy wysłać każdego pomocnika ale najlepszy do tego jest naukowiec. Medyka wysyłamy do zwalczania wirusów w terenie, dyplomata służy do obniżenia kosztów budowy baz, pracownik terenowy (security) ogłasza kwarantanny w miastach. Każdy z pomocników może robić to samo, ale jedni bardziej do tego się nadają niż inni zwłaszcza na wyzszych poziomach. 
Wysyłając personel zdobywają oni doświadczenie i awansują automatycznie robiąc się skuteczniejsi w swojej specjalizacji. Możemy mieć max 5 baz i 5 pomocników. Miast nie jest za dużo na mapie i są one połączone drogami, więc w pewnym momencie rozgrywami partię szachów. 

Jedynym skomplikowaniem jest rozwoój epidemi gdyż musimy kontrolować jej rozprzestrzenianie i czy nam nie zmutowała. Badania nad wirusem to przydzielenie naukowców do jego DNA, które początkowo jest proste. Po każdej mutacji dostajemy nowy kod, który musimy także zbadać. Wygrana to zbadanie całego kodu lub wyleczenie całej populacji.

W porównaniu do "Plagi" gra jest mało rozbudowana, więc po rozegraniu jednego scenariusza raczej niczego więcej się w obecnej formie nie spodziewam. Nawet nie ma o czym za bardzo się rozpisać.

Gra nie warta swej ceny, tym bardziej że za tyle samo mamy "Plagę", a nawet w promocji warto się zastanowić. Lepiej poczekać i zobaczyć w jakim kierunku gra się rozwinie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077186290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1509369548}
review:
처음에는 약간 판데믹 보드게임이 생각났습니다만..

일단 PC게임이라는 점을 빼면 판데믹보다 못하다는 느낌마져 듭니다.

더 다양한 방식으로 구성 할 수 있을것 같은데 말이죠

지구는 둥글지만 여기에서는 그져 평면의 세계입니다. 

태평양을 건너지 못한다는게 이상하군요. 심지어 전염병 주식회사와도 비교되는..

게임의 난이도를 떠나서 단순한 구성은 게임의 재미를 떨어뜨린다고 봅니다.

이런류의 게임은 이벤트가 중요한데...그마져도 하다보면 중복되는 느낌이라서 심각하내요

아...참고로 전염병 주식회사는 이제 멀티도 된다죠. (한숨)

아직 앞서 해보기라는 점에서 평가를 이런식으로 하였지만

환불하지 않고 기대는 해보겠습니다...............하아..

author: {'steamid': '76561198021895265', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1614256857}
review:
总之分开进行一下简单的评分：
画面：7/10——美术和UI都不错，虽然事件有CG，但是从OP中就能看到，重复利用率很高，希望未来能够加入更多的CG和动态影像。

音效：7/10——关卡背景音乐只有一首，不过对气氛紧张的烘托不错，角色的配音也确实表达了意思，仅仅因为量少而有些单调。

优化：7/10——我在好几台不同系统的机器上都试了试，大概也是小游戏的原因吧，基本都看不到卡顿掉帧之类的问题。
（4月14日优化分数由9下降至7）

游戏性：4/10——这里是目前的核心问题，下面基本都在讲这个_(:зゝ∠)_
（4月14日游戏性分数由3提高至4）


游戏本身是人类在宏观层面上用各种手段抗击疾病的传播，但是目前来看，游戏的行进顺序完全和你要做什么以及疾病是什么类型半点关系也没有，你要做的就是：建办公室、建办公室、招人、治疗、建办公室、治疗、封锁、采样……然后到了中后期围追堵截病毒传染的时候基本上又是重复不断地建造隔离区和治疗新生的疾病，操作基本被定型了。

即使是偶尔发生的事件也基本看不出任何的差别，几个处理方式的消耗也基本没有区别，至于结果，至多也就是爆发加剧，最烂的可能性就是城市沦陷，但是城市沦陷也没有任何发展可言，也没有二次传播或者后续事件，不如说除非已经到了剩余1~4点的生死关头，否则忽视事件代价真的小的可怜。

再者，疾病传播的次数似乎被限制为3了，因而再怎么样，只要有3位以上的特工，疫情几乎不会超出你的掌控，更不用说4~5位特工轮番休息和行动的时候了。

行动成功率这是个特别奇怪的东西，原本以为会产生这么几种情况：大成功/无伤、成功/受伤、失败/无伤，大失败/受伤。然而隔离中全部都使用的是类似于“交血保平安”的制度，只要特工HP足够，事件就是绝对成功的，因而安保人员的行动代价降低加上防弹衣，行动中就是无敌的存在……

科技方面，鸡肋的东西不少，最终科技之一消毒的存在感又过于强大了，所以在弄完特工上限升级后，高难度可能考虑下防弹衣，之后就一直线奔着消毒去了，科技可以说是没什么弹性，因为绝大多数的东西都没有使用价值……

而后，从科研上可以看到游戏里似乎还内置了其他针对疾病症状的行动，但是这些手段目前的版本里我找不到任何施行的位置，大概是因为只是先行而没有制作吧。

最后来看，我们操作的公司和社会与事件等等互动性也是非常低下的，如果按照现实中的情况来看，任何一座城市居民是否配合，当地安保力量是否足够，资金投入是否充足都有可能影响到疾病传播的情况，然而这些东西全部都被“大而化之”，转变成一个个如刚才所说过的爆发事件，我们基本上找不到这个游戏应有的“决策者”的感觉。

即使以早期体验版来看，里面的内容也显得过于单薄了，这个游戏目前真的只有一个雏形而已，让我看到了这个游戏的方向和乐趣，但是目前放出来的内容枯到我没办法给它好评，我会持续关注游戏的发展的，希望能越做越好。

4月14日追记：移动内容加入确实让游戏变得不确定性变高，也产生了对应的风险，但是这让总部的选择成了赌运气的工作，这点上令人有些不快。

事件发生频率变高了，同时不同事件造成的反应结果和几率也被表明了，这是个很好的改动。

优化变差了，游戏有不少地方出现了明显卡顿和声音丢失，希望能够迅速处理。

author: {'steamid': '76561198031777377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1490310004}

author: {'steamid': '76561198092075590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1489924153}

author: {'steamid': '76561198165119172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1521971013}
review:
三个地图三个困难玩熟悉之后完全就是很简单了！隔离城市和技能隔离城市内不受伤害只要有着两个基本上就可以稳稳地通关不在话下，希望跟《瘟疫公司》一样多出点模式，主要打完之后就感觉太无聊了，完全没有乐趣，一点压力都没有怎么体验这个游戏的虐心，不求出太多！难度上面一定要多出点！也可以和《9.1.1》学习一些细节玩家可以玩操控。总体而言安全人员就是个后期BUG，受伤害只有1点，隔离城市100%。虽然还在研发中，但感觉如果难度高点，花样多点就更加完美了！现在的话入手感觉还是没刚开始。
主要的地方就是在于花样太少！

author: {'steamid': '76561198088013862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1518011776}
review: 这游戏想法挺好，还是推荐下，毕竟还是开发中的，但是想变成特别好玩的神作的话，起码玩法要完全改变，首先能招募的角色固定就那么几个，死光就没了，建议隔离区这种应该单纯花钱，而不是要人去，派人这点应该改善下只需要研发，镇压骚乱就行了，科技少了点，游戏目标和输赢设定也要改，跟其他评论说的一样，对抗一个瘟疫失败，起码全人类死光才算失败，感染和死亡是完全不同的东西，也有感染后没死反而出现抗体的，现在的游戏只能说是个创意雏形，一般用来众筹发布的试玩版那样简陋，这种题材本身应该很刺激，然而回合制限制太大，如果能跟瘟疫工厂那样即时制对抗病毒，那才是完美，开头说的推荐，只是推荐这个题材，并不推荐现在买，现在的价格过高，已经是成品的价格，开发中的游戏steam上够多了，很多好题材搞砸的先例。

author: {'steamid': '76561198113519256', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1495711501}
review:
目前还不推荐，游戏性不足，缺乏玩下去的动力，只有单人模式的情况下怎么玩都像是在做教程。和价格差不多的瘟疫公司相比，难度低了很多，突发事件存在感很低，目前的三种疾病类型差别不大，缺乏特色。开局外交官然后点科学家，基本就是教程难度了，这种情况下团队技能就变得可有可无，三种疾病的突变带来的影响也非常小，完全不影响胜利。作为一款偶尔打发时间的策略小游戏尚且不足，没有达到期待的水平。
希望制作组继续努力，把这个不错的点子做得更完善一些，或者出对抗模式，应该更值得一玩
官中加一分，画风加一分，创意加一分 5/10
------------------5月 24日更新编辑---------------------
突发事件的存在感提高了，中文翻译的质量提高了，特工移动范围有了限制，男女特工的差异性出现了，尤其是男女特工的差异和移动范围的限制，给游戏性的提高带来了很积极的影响。
一个建议，更新后的突发事件虽然存在感更高，但感觉可以增加突发事件和对应特工的关系，比如分发药物的成功率和场上是否存在医疗人员，以及医疗人员的等级挂钩；镇压骚乱的成功率和场上是否存在安全人员，以及安全人员的等级挂钩；贿赂法官的成功率和场上是否存在外交人员，以及外交人员的等级挂钩等等。这样一来，突发事件对游戏进程的影响会更大，特工的等级会更有价值，团队技能中增加特工获得经验的技能会更有意义。
把不推荐改成推荐，经过几次更新，游戏性确实得到了提高，而且开发组也确实在听取玩家的意见，期待以后的更新。
游戏性提高加一分，开发组态度加0.5分 6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197981528532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1495661133}
review:
В принципе, игра хорошая. Но, понятное дело, в ней много еще нужно доделать. Да и дополнительное содержимое очень не помешает. 
Во-первых, все-таки усложнить и продумать экономическую систему. Филиалы по всему миру открываются быстро, штат пополняется тоже очень быстро, и скоро деньги становится некуда девать даже на высоком уровне сложности.
Во-вторых, сбалансировать ту же сложность. Часто выигрыш или проигрыш зависит от случайностей. Как карта ляжет. Нет, эффект случанойсти должен быть, безусловно, но он не должен так сильно влиять на геймплей. 
В-третьих. Ну, по аналогии с Plague, можно ввести зависимость скорости распространения и мутации болезни от климата, а еще добавить способы распространения патогена - самолеты, корабли, наземный транспорт, животны. Плюс, можно также добавить и методы распространения у людей, через жидкость, воздух и так далее. 
В-четвертых, можно все-таки разделить врачей на тех же вирусологов, иммунологов, аллергологов и так далее. Ввести более узкую специализацию агентов.
В-пятых, местоположение базы практически ни на что не влияет, поскольку агенты моментально добираются до места. Может тогда ввести время на дорогу? А само местоположение штаб-квартиры можно также усиливать или ослаблять уровнем развитости медицины в городе, где она расположена, а также в городах вокруг. 
В-шестых. Несмотря на описание вируса, мутирует он крайне медленно. Его можно спокойно победить, не дав выбраться за пределы трех базовых свойств. 
В-седьмых, не помешали бы и прочие стороны "конфликта". Те же фармакологические корпорации, которые могли бы вставлять палки в колеса, лишь бы получить дополнительную прибыль. Или правозащитные организации, которые своими благими намерениями могли бы тормозить или напротив, ускорять поиск болезни и выполнение операций. 
В-восьмых, думаю, не помешает увеличить список агентов и список городов. Последние, кстати, можно раздробить, например, по плотности, а не только на мегаполисы. У каждой плотности населения можно было бы ввести свои особенности распространения болезни и, соответственно, свои особенности лечения и предотвращения заболеваний.
В-девятых, БОЛЬШЕ ТЕХНОЛОГИЙ ДЛЯ ИНЖЕНЕРОВ!
В-десятых, может, имеет смысл также ввести графу не только здоровья у агентов, но и, например, шкалу усталости и морального здоровья?

В целом, как я уже сказал выше, игра неплохая. Партии длятся быстро. Напряжения хватает. Но только если ставить на уровень сложности "Высокий". Тут вот многие пишут про одноразовость - так я не согласен. Может, за раз вы несколько партий и не сыграете, но возвращаться раз в пару дней сюда точно можно после работы. Отличная разминка для мозгов и просто средство для интеллектуального отдыха.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036250410', 'num_games_owned': 1719, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1488027111}
review:
I'm gonna go with yes, but it's a cautious yes.

I've played a couple of hours and enjoyed it, but it is fairly simple and I've probably just about exhausted the replayability it has *in its current state* (though I might go for the last achievement). Edit: done.

The price is pretty questionable for what there is right now. I don't subscribe to the idea that games can be reduced to a simple cost/hour formula, but all the same, I do feel like a game that only really has a few hours in it should probably be under £10 unless it has something special to recommend it, which this game doesn't. It's stable and performant, and it's fun enough, but it's not going to be blowing anyone away, and it's not a game you'll be remembering for years, so I feel like maybe £6-7 would be more appropriate - at that price point it would be a definite thumbs up.

That said, it's only been in early access a couple of weeks and has some potential for expansion in both content and tactical depth. If you like XCOM but sometimes want something a bit more casual - a shorter session with less in depth analysis needed at every move - then this fits the bill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198363361588', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1492845819}
review: 这个游戏让我想到了我玩的一个桌游名字叫做《瘟疫危机》。玩着马马虎虎吧。还是疾病的种类太少，可以雇佣的人员种类太少了。而且不是怎么耐玩，基本15-20分钟一局。在摸清了套路之后根本没什么难度了。期待能在将来丰富玩法吧。不过话说这个价格和内容相比性价比不是很高。不是很急着想玩的不推荐在没打折的时候买。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025465081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1509492442}
review: This game has been likened to Pandemic, where the game play I liked but did not particularly like co-op in addition to the game being brutally difficult, even on Easy.  Thus, I wanted to play but didn't enjoy it.  Well, this game scratches that itch!  This game is beautifully presented and has great potential and if the Developers live up to their forum "promises" of more content, this game will become a gem.  The high expectations for Early Access games don’t always materialize but people should RATE THIS GAME ON ITS POTENTIAL, which is easy to see, and not just because right now there are some issues.  Realize please, that's the essence of Early Access, progressive improvement and rate the game on how you envision it to be, not on weaknesses you see now.   I will agree that out of the chute this game screams for a little more content (especially new Scenarios) but the Developers have "promised" those things are coming.  Support the game folks, I highly recommend it.  And Developers, please (PLEASE!) keep up the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057047735', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1650221740}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118021715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1564699168}
review:
Bardzo fajna i obiecująca gra, przypominająca planszówkę "Pandemic".  Dźwiękowo, muzycznie i graficznie jest już gotowym produktem ze swojej półki cenowej. 

Jeśli traktować ją jako komputerową wersję gry planszowej, ustępuje tylko kilku tytułom, choć trochę wysoko się ceni. 

Jedyny problem (i powód, dla którego zalecam poważne zastanowienie się przed zakupem) to gameplay (jest przyjemnie ale krótko i bardzo szybko robi się powtarzalnie) i brak multiplayera.

ZASADY (ciągle ulegają zmianie, producent jest aktywny na forach zapowiadając plany i rozliczając się z nich):
- wybieramy jedną z 3 odmian choroby (modyfikacja zasad odnośnie mutacji i rozprzestrzeniania);
- wybieramy jednego z 4 specjalistów: medyk (leczy więcej punktów choroby), naukowiec (zbiera więcej próbek), polityk (bazy kosztują mniej) lub ochroniarz (otrzymuje mniej obrażeń). Normalnie w grze mamy do zatrudnienia po 2 sztuki z każdej klasy, więc ten wybór daje potencjał posiadania 3 z wybranego typu, dodatkowo każdy niesie ze sobą pierwszą technologię z jednego z drzewek rozwoju;
- wybieramy miejsce startu (bez znaczenia - w odróżnieniu od Pandemic mamy tylko jedną akcję na specjalistę, ale za to możemy ją wykonać w dowolnym miejscu, bez konieczności podróży);
- co turę choroba rozwija się infekując miasta sąsiadujące z już zarażonymi lub zaostrza się w zainfekowanym mieście. Choroba startuje z jednym znacznikiem w mieście, zaostrzenie oznacza dodatkowy znacznik, jeśli dojdzie do 4 - tracimy miasto, jeśli suma znaczników przekroczy pewną wartość - przegrywamy grę;
- co turę każdy specjalista dostaje jedną akcję: budowa bazy (zwiększają dochód, kluczowe max 4, po ulepszeniu max 5), leczenie choroby (usuwa znacznik z miasta, medyk usuwa więcej, misto pozostaje podatne na chorobę, chyba że odkryjemy stosowne ulepszenie), kwarantanna (kosztowne, ale lepsze niż leczenie, bo miasto dostaje dwa, trzy z ulepszeniem, znaczniki tarczy, które wchłaniają nowe znaczniki choroby, dodatkowo akcje w mieście pod kwarantanną są bezpieczniejsze), leczenie specjalisty lub zbieranie próbek (potrzebne do wynalezienia lekarstwa, naukowiec zbiera więcej, ulepszenie zwiększa dodatkowo tą liczbę). 
- każda akcja wiąże się z ryzykiem otrzymania obrażeń tym większym im więcej znaczników choroby jest w mieście. Obrażenia za każdym razem to 5, bohaterowie mają 10hp, ulepszenie redukuje tą liczbę o 1, ochroniarze dostają jeszcze mniejsze, ryzyko otrzymania obrażeń jest mniejsze gdy miasto jest pod kwarantanną.
- każda akcja skutkuje przyznaniem doświadczenia, które przekłada się na awans postaci. Awansować można do poziomu 3 za każdym razem zwiększając bonus klasowy (medyk leczy jeszcze więcej, naukowiec zbiera jeszcze więcej próbek itd.).
- bohaterów możemy dokupić (koniecznie, jeden z pierwszych wydatków) do max 4, 5 po ulepszeniu. Pula składa się z ośmiu - po 2 z każdej klasy - i nie uzupełnia się po zakupie ani śmierci od obrażeń.
- drzewa technologiczne znacznie ułatiwają rozgrywkę (mniej obrażeń, choroba wolniej się rozprzestrzenia, mniejsza szansa na obrażenia, redukcja znaczników choroby do zera całkowicie eliminuje chorobę - miasto nie jest podatne - co otwiera alternatywną drogę zwycięstwa itp.), jednak ulepszenia postępują bardzo wolno, można to przyśpieszyć (redukcja do 1 tech na turę), kupując bardzo drogich techników.
- podstawowy sposób na wygraną to zebranie odpowiedniej ilości próbek i pokonaniu "składowej" DNA choroby. Składowe różnią się trudnością zwalczenia i ilością w zależności od poziomu trudności, nowe składowe mogą pojawić się w wyniku mutacji choroby. Zwalczanie trwa bardzo długo więc konieczne bedzie zatrudnienie badaczy.
- bohaterowie kosztują 30k, badacze 50k, technicy 80k, więc wygrana poprzez technologię jest najdroższa, ale jeśli przetrwamy do odkrycia ulepszeń spowalniających chorobę i redukujących obrażenia, jest z górki. 

Eksperymentowanie z różnymi sposobami leczenia choroby jest świetną zabawą, ale na hardzie trzeba mieć już gotowy plan działania, bo naprawdę czuć że wszystko wymyka się nam z rąk a zegar tyka.
Średnia rozgrywka zajmuje 18 tur, na easy można się bawić do 40 i eksperymentować, na hardzie po 4 turach niekontrolowania choroby przegrywamy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065842379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1486994493}
review:
[h1]Review zu Quarantine[/h1]

Quarantine ist ein Strategiespiel und quasi der Gegenpart zu Plague Inc. ( In Plague Inc. musste man als Seuche die Welt zerstören und in Quarantine geht es darum, genau diese zu bekämpfen ).
Dieses Spiel ist seit ein paar Tagen erst im Early Access aber bietet schon 3 verschiedene "Krankheitstypen", weitere sollen laut Entwickler bis zu Release noch hinzugefügt werden genauso wie weitere verschiedene Szenarios.

[b]Zu den Schwierigkeitsgraden ( Leicht, Mittel, Schwer) muss ich etwas anmerken: [/b]
Es haben sich einige in anderen Reviews darüber beschwert, dass es trotz schwerster Schwierigkeit immer noch zu leicht ist. Meine Vermutung ist, dass es aktuell egal ist, welche Schwierigkeitsstufe man wählt, den es ist alles das selbe. Grund für meine Annahme ist die Auflistung bei der Szenario Beschreibung (da verändert sich nichts an den Schwierigkeitsfaktoren auch wann man die verschiedensten durchschaltet). Das wird aber sicher bis zum Release auch noch vernünftig hinzugefügt ;)

Wer Plague Inc. schon immer gern gespielt hat und sich immer über die Wissenschaftler geärgert hat, die ein Heilmittel erforscht haben, wird hier viel Freude haben, mal die andere Sichtweise kennenzulernen. Hier gibt es aktuell 4 Spezialisten ( Sanitäter, Wissenschaftler, Diplomat und einen Security Beamten). Man startet mit einer der 4 Spezialisten und hat dadurch einen Punkt im Techtree erforscht, der zu diesem Spezialisten gehört. Beim Security Beamten wäre das, dass die Spezialisten bei Operationen weniger Schaden bekommen. Das Spiel ist Rundenbasiert und jede Runde kann jeder Spezialist eine von 5 Aktionen ausführen (HQ errichten, Behandeln, Erforschen, Quarantäne oder den Spezialisten heilen). 
[list]
[*]Geld bekommt man von seinen HQ (+10000, max. 4 Stck mit Skill 5 Stck)
[*]Forschungspunkte (zum erforschen des Heilmittels) bekommt man durch Erforschung, am besten mit einem Wissenschaftler
[*]Für den Techtree benötigt man keine Punkte, der benötigt nur eine gewisse Rundenanzahl
[*]Jeder Spezialist startet bei Stufe 1, für jede Stufe bekommt er +1 auf seine Spezialisierung
[/list]

[b]PROs:[/b]
[list]
[*]bietet aktuell schon einige Stunden Spielspaß
[*]keine Bugs, Lags, Ruckler etc.
[*]leicht verdiente Erfolge
[*]Preis ist ok, wenn man die Entwickler unterstützen möchte und kein fertiges Spiel erwartet
[/list]

[b]CONTRAs:[/b]
[list]
[b]Weniger Negativ-Punkte, vielmehr Anmerkungen für die Entwickler![/b]
[*]Stellenweise keine Deutsche Übersetzung
[*]fehlende wirkliche!!!! Schwierigkeitsgrade
[/list]

Alles in allem finde ich das Spiel schon sehr gelungen, nach knapp 6 Stunden habe ich allerdings alle Szenarios und alle Schwierigkeitsgrade durch und habe 100% Achievements erreicht. 

Wer kein Problem hat, die Entwickler zu unterstützen und quasi ein Spiel im Alpha Stadium zu spielen, der kann hier Bedenkenlos zugreifen. Vom Gameplay her fühlt sich Quarantine nicht mehr wie ein Alpha Spiel an, einzig der fehlende Content und Kleinigkeiten wie die Übersetzung und der Schwierigkeitsgrad zeigen dann noch, dass dieses Spiel erst noch in der Entwicklung ist. 
Ich jedenfalls sehe zuversichtlich in die Zukunft und freue mich auf neue Updates :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198099381725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1486719121}
review:
玩法很有创意，相信很多人都是冲着瘟疫公司”反转篇“而来的，但是现版本并不建议入手，内容太少，上手后一局也就十来分钟，平衡性不足，玩法也非常单一，选择外交官开局，马上建造办事处，留意一下城市感染情况就行了

个人对游戏修改建议:
1.增加疾病种类，最好像瘟疫公司那样对各种疾病有个详细的说明
2.取消疾病移动路径，学习瘟疫公司的飞机轮船系统，毕竟那样更加真实，不是吗？
3.特工种类设置说实话挺限制游戏玩法，需要更加明确的职能分工
4.增加事件种类

暂时就想到这些，以后看情况我再重新入手吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561197960696332', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1486684381}
review:
Many of the reviews here are saying that the game is too short, and whilst I can't disagree with that, I don't mind a game being short as long as there's replay value in it. The main issue I have is that there isn't really that much to do whilst you're actually playing the game.

You have 5 possible actions when making a turn per character:

- Treat disease
- Quarantine city
- Heal operative
- Build office
- Take sample

The trouble is that for many turns only 2 of these are actually applicable, as these 3 aren't:

- Heal operative is only relevant when your operative is actually injured
- Build office can only be used 5 times in the entire game, since you're limited to that many offices
- Take sample can be used more often, however you're limited by how many samples you actually need and whether your lab needs them anytime soon

This means that your choice of actions is actually greatly limited and in general you don't have that many courses of action available to you on each turn. Now there is research to be getting on with, but again it's quite limited and doesn't need any input rather than deciding which one to go for (currently there is one that prevents cities being reinfected, which most people tend to aim for).

For me and with this being a turn based game I think more depth is needed before I can recommend it. Please don't scream 'BUT IT'S EARLY ACCESS' as I'm well aware of that, but all I can do is review the game in it's current state, not on the promise of things to come (none of which have actually been made yet).

I'll happily re-review the game positively if it does improve, but for now I don't think it's worth purchasing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236479924', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1498280398}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992462093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1511514965}
review:
Quarantine

Conclusion:
I recommend Quarantine as long as development continues which I suspect it will from the developer's posts on the form and care that has been shown in form posts.

Pros:
- Turn based
- Random events that affect gameplay
- Simple and effective UI
- Early access if development continues
- Cheep for the quality at only $13.49 at the time of this post

Cons:
- Early access with some minor bugs and missing information which appears to already be under repair by the developer
- Short also due to being early access
- Easy also due to being early access

Review on gameplay balance:

(Based on my analysis of the game on hard mode only with 100% in achivements)

I have found 3 paths to victory which are:
Medic Path = Easy
Soldier Path = Medium
Scientist Path = Hard
(for more details please see my post in the pined suggestions post in the form {didnt want to leave spoilers})

I suspect that the game was balanced around the Scientist Path and that the Soldier Path was suspected by the developer  while the Medic Path was overlooked in balancing considering some gameplay oversights in the Medic class

author: {'steamid': '76561198154425859', 'num_games_owned': 1242, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1494513482}
review:
[h1]It’s revenge for the Plague in a turn-based strategy game that lets you turn the tables on disease and cure the world.[/h1]
Quarantine is exactly the name of the game in this cross between Plague Inc and XCOM. Though, IMHO the game is a junior version of both, with only some of the traits of each. It could almost be a mod for Plague Inc., except that it is a much simpler game. 

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
The game is composed of 3 disease types, which need to be beaten on hard mode to 100% the game. This means that theoretically, given you understand the gameplay, you could beat it in 3 games after the short tutorial. But, there are also 4 different classes, like in XCOM. You play with all 4, but you start with your choice, which makes for totally diverse game play depending on your start. You also have 4 different start cities, which seem to me to have little to nothing to do with result. I chose to start with playing the 3 disease types on medium difficulty, each time with a different start class. No problems were encountered. I had all the achieves except for that final one, so I then did the final 3 hard mode games for the win in a total of 8 hours. (6 games) It could have been much less, except I played around with the different classes a bit, and I played totally online the whole time. 

But, choosing the order of operations, and selecting chokepoints for quarantining cities cost effectively is where most of the fun gameplay comes in. Once you’ve solved the formula for this, there is no replay value at all. Unless of course the game is expanded with dlc that is. 

[b]Graphics & Art:[/b] 
Given the simplistic system of UI, the graphics and art are both well done. I saw no problems whatsoever. The music and sound effects were great. The men & women operatives had their cliché phrases like in XCOM. They gave their lives willingly if need be. It was an enjoyable experience for me, seeing that sim & tbt are my favorite genre. Very satisfying gameplay I must say, overall, though quite easy. And, if you have problems with that, in the same way that shots can be missed in XCOM (even with 97% chance) you can save & reload whenever you want to beat the rng. 

[b]Pros:[/b]
*Balanced gameplay- The system works. Quarantining is effective, classes matter.
*Turn based means low pressure. Good saving system. 
*The operatives are very enjoyable like in XCOM.
*Game loads FAST. Instantly saving & reloading. Everything is instant. 

[b]Cons:[/b] 
*No replay value after earning 100% achievements. Needs an ironman mode.
*The individual operatives within a class are only cosmetically different. So, one scientist is the same as the next scientist. This should be changed to give them differing skills within a class.
*The game is not enough of a challenge for most gamers. If you want an easy introduction into games like Plague Inc. This is it.
*No multiplayer at this time. Totally single player.

[h1]Quarantine is a game that has about 8 hours of fun to offer, and a hope for more content to come, since the game is in early access at this point.[/h1] If you want to get in at the beginning of what looks to be a great game, I’d grab this while it is on sale. However, many may want to wait for more content/ lower sales. I’ve had a great evening with the game, and am looking forward to checking back for updates, though I probably won’t play it again until more content is available.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340676747', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1486762194}
review:
Jeux sympa où l'on retrouve vraiment le jeux Plague Inc, sauf qu'on n'est plus du coté du virus.

Par contre le jeux se termine en 4 heures sans faire le tuto et en faisant tous les niveaux pour les trois scénarios. Le mode difficile est assez compliqué suivant la position de départ de la maladie.

Du coup le jeu est assez court. Le dévelopement du scénario est limité. En attendant qu'ils fassent évoluer le jeux, c'est quand même assez décevant.

Peut mieux faire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031933439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1486796181}
review: Игра одноразовая. Очень похоже на порт какой-то настольной игры и свойственной настольным играм механике. Игра находится в раннем доступе, но уже достаточно сбалансирована. Не смотря на баланс, игровой процесс уныл. К сожалению.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032842878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1627768373}
review:
*Early Access Review*
The game has great potential... (and I loved the boardgame that inspired it) 

edit:
I did not recommend this game in my previous review yet, because the game did not have enough strategy, difficulty and replay value. Luckily, the developers have listened to the community feedback and the gameplay has improved a lot since the last update. (Basically all my concerns with the game have been fixed since then)
- the starting location matters now
- there are more diffences between the "heroes" you can choose: with the addition of movement points you really have to choose now: Do I want someone who is fast, who can take a lot of hits or someone who can heal better?
- the events in the game are more interesting and diverse

For those who liked "Pandemic" the board game:
The core of the game is the same: find a strategy to heal a pandemic outbreak with limited resources and a disease that gets worse every turn. There is a big difference though: this is a single player experience, so you won't have the discussions between the players on what to do next. However the game makes up for it in several ways:
- Good graphics: clean but charming interface that is easy to understand
- More randomness: events have a chance to fail (you can see the success-% before you choose)
- Easier to understand: you don't have to read the rules first - you can always see what you are allowed to do and what you can't do (and why)

This game is still in early access and there is room for improvement, but it's already in a very good state. And I haven't experienced a single bug yet. (sadly this is a big feature nowadays^^)

Conclusion (TLDR):
You should try this game if you like strategy games but don't want to spend hours for each game. Each game is short but interesting. It is not as deep as CIV or some other big strategy titles - and it shouldn't be: i can easily finish a game in under an hour, but then i want to start again... see what changes, what i could make differently. And the feeling of doom when the disease spreads to another continent just gets me every time :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004819024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1486834639}
review:
I bought this game because it looked like an ipad game that I enjoy called Plague inc, only from the other side of the table (curing instead of infecting the world). 

I was very disappointed. Plague inc runs in real time and allows the player to use DNA points to evolve interesting abilities and symptoms. 

Quarantine is a boring turn based game where the "plague" can only jump between connected cities (how unrealistic), and there is no mention of symptoms. Every infection is boring basic "bacteria" or "virus". 

Thoroughly unengaging, uninteresting and unrealistic. Save your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993270815', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1493662369}
review:
If you enjoy Pandemic you may like this, it is a much simpler and cut down version meant for one person. 

The Medium difficulty is a bit too easy but Hard is kicking my ass; it is EA and needs a bit more love to justify the price tag unless you have an unhealthy interest in diseases. $15 ain't bad by any stretch just depends on how much you value your time/dollar ratio.

There is a lot of potential here, though I'm not sure how much they can do without treading on Z-Man Games IP but I'm sure it can be worked on. I have no regrets picking it up, but I do sort of have an unhealthy interest in disease.

Update: Just broke 3 hours in and beat the 3 pathogens on Hard. 

Fun game, and I still do recommend it but it is really rather short. Hopefully some new teammates and disease types are added along with something else to spice it up. Once you get your method down (For me its 2 Medic, Scientist and Diplomat (or 3rd Medic depending on who I start with) it becomes rather easy. After struggling with Bacteria on Hard I beat Prion on my second try and Virus on my first. 

Still, fun game just needs some more meat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122672421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1487086409}
review:
TL;DR The game is way too short for its price.

I have played this game for 1 hour and have 12/19 achievements, and have played through the tutorial, Bacteria easy mode, and Bacteria Normal Mode twice. The devs said that there is about 34 hours gameplay, because there are 34 different scenarios (based on the amount of combinations you can make with location, starting operative, and disease (3*4*3). As I have already stated; I have played through 4 scenarios (3 excl tutorial) in 1 hour. If you think about it this way, you have a maximum of 9 hours gameplay, with little variation between each scenario meaning that if you're only playing to get all achievements (as I do in games that can be played without end) it could take as little as 4 or 5 hours to beat this game. Unless the hard mode is a lot harder than the super easy "normal" mode, then this game has way too little gameplay, and should either reduce it's price to at least £3.99 or triple the amount of content it currently has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220104595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1486793251}
review:
内容太少，磨磨蹭蹭3小时全成就
3困难通关思路：[spoiler] 安保人员开局，主要点第二竖科技，根据损血程度可以点一个100%回血，前期快速造够3个理事馆，再买一个保安，第三个人员根据瘟疫种类选择医生或者保安，前4回合任由瘟疫扩散发展（注意一下如果一个城市累计到了4点，那么就无法操作这个城市，玩阮病毒这关尤其注意城市病毒累计量），等第四回合高级医疗研究结束以后，基本上就可以稳住局面，一般16回合结束[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198055691099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1497882646}
review:
EDIT: This Review has been updated following the Ebola Outbreak Update.

I really want to like Quarantine. The idea of desperately trying to fend off the end of civilization is very appealing to me. However, the game suffers many problems, both thematic and mechanical. EDIT: Many of the mechanical problems have been improved with the Ebola Update. While the game is still somewhat shallow(3-4 hours of unique gameplay, maybe another 3-5 on top of that if you want to try out all the diseases.), it is a massive improvement over how it previously was(90 minutes of shallow gameplay). However, it is now out of early access with a slew of major problems remaining. I am uncertain if the devs will even bother to update it anymore.

Thematic problems: This game has several mechanics and simply pieces of information that go against the narrative and logic. 

1. Time: The game takes place over the course of 15-30 days, with humanity either dying spontaneously(more on that later) or being saved in that time period. This, in short, makes absolutely no sense. The idea that a disease capable of quickly overwhelming the globe in a matter of weeks could also be cured in a week(see point 2) is preposterous. EDIT: This remains unchanged in the Ebola update.

2. The cure: In Quarantine, the cure takes 4 scientists, 150,000$, and about a week. Yup, 150K. Any major company or even tiny nation could afford to cure the disease. Honestly, any middle class person could blow their retirement money and cure it. That's nonsensical. EDIT: This remains unchanged as of the Ebola update. 

3.  Life without the cure. It is totally possible to stop the disease without studying it at all. How? By cruely allowing all those in infected areas to die with strict quarantines? Nope. It turns out this humanity-destroying virus can be wiped from a city by a competent doctor working for a day. Yes, 1 doctor working for 1 day can purge a city as large as NYC(see below) in a day. Without a cure, without any money. EDIT: As of the Ebola update, while it is still POSSIBLE to do this, it is generally more effective to cure the disease. 

4. Cities. All cities function the exact same in Quarantine, regardless of size, which adds to a lack of depth(see next section). EDIT: This remains unchanged as of the Ebola Update. 

5. Fail state. You lose the game when a certain number of people are infected. This can lead to some ridiculous moments where you lose the game even though huge parts of the world remain uninfected. Unfortunately, this is at the core of the game's mechanics, and therefor is unlikely to change. EDIT: This remains unchanged as of the Ebola Update.

Mechanics: All of the above, while they can take you out of the experience, aren't enough to make the game bad. This game fails for exactly 1 reason, it has no depth. 

1. Classes: The 4 classes are somehwat unbalanced and ridiculous in their flexibility. Every class can do everything, with each class getting a bonus to something. The worst is the scientist, which get more samples when they collect. The total number of samples you need is like 16 over the course of the game, so this bonus is very weak(EDIT: this remains unchanged as of the Ebola update). EDIT(as of the ebola update): The next is the diplomat, who saves money when building bases. This bonus is useful for the first quarter-to-half of the game, after which it  becomes completely redundant due to the cap on the number of bases you can have. Hiring them at the begining is a choice between extra money and effective treatment. Second to best, the security takes less damage if they get injured. EDIT: as of the Ebola Update, every class has more hp, and missions are less risky. Combine that with the bonus to curing being later, and while this class is still good, it isn't way better than every other anymore. Best is the medic, which have a bonus to the afformentioned easy curing of a city.EDIT: The tech to increase treatment amounts is now very hard to get, making the medic very useful throughout the game.

2. Technology. Tech provides the vast majority of progress, outshining everything else. There are a total of 16 techs, total. EDIT: As of the Ebola update, the tech tree has been rearanged to make the best tech's harder to come by. As a result, deciding on tech is a very important decision that adds quite a bit of depth to the game. 

3. Research. You spend 12-16 samples and take 1-4 weeks depending on how much you spend. It's kind of shocking how a game about curing a super-plague has such a barebones cure system.EDIT: This remains more or less unchanged with the ebola update. Diseases can mutate to make it take marginally longer to cure, but in my expierence they rarely ever do that. 

4. Disease types. There are 5 as of version 1.0. The first, Virus, mutates(gains new traits) at a marginally higher rate(The speed of 2 snails instead of the speed of 1). The second, Bacteria, spreads between cities faster. The third, Prion, spreads fast within cities.The fourth Ebola, worsks just like viruses. The fifth, Fungus, works just like bacteria. Bacteria/Fungus is by far the hardest, because how much you can cure in a single city scales rapidly, while how many cities you can at one time barely scales at all. 

EDIT: As of the Ebola update, units now take time to move. This positioning adds difficulty and depth to the game. 

TLDR my overall thoughts: After the Ebola update, I was excited to watch the developement of this game. After all, the update improved many of the game's problems, but still kept the EA tag. This signalled to me that the game was going to be continually improved. However, the version 1.0 update barely did anything at all, and moved the game out of EA. It appears this game is done being developed. It still has about 3-5 hours of unique gameplay to it. If that and the unique premise is worth $10 to you, then feel free to pick it up. Otherwise, might be best to wait for a sale

author: {'steamid': '76561198114327617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1487359248}
review:
Quarantine, is a game based on the simulation of a disease outbreak either as a: Bacteria, Virus, and Prion (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prion) Cause I had no idea what it was to be honest. This game is pretty good for the price tag, but it lacks one thing. Replayability. You can easily learn how to beat this game even on the hardest difficulty, and once you get a certain strategy that works it is pretty likely that you will keep using it. 

This game reminds me of another disease outbreak game called Pandemic which is free online, except in Pandemic your goal is to wipe out the human race, although Madagascar always never gets infected!!!

Overall I would say this is a good game, except again for replayability, and considering this is a simulation game of you staring at one screen it's not like the graphics matter to much considering it doesn't take much to run.

I give this game:
6.5 / 10 Cabbages on the would Play Again Scale.
7 / 10 Cabbages on the Price Scale.
4.5 / 10 Cabbages on the Difficulty Scale

--------------------------------------------------------------Edit-------------------------------------------------------------------------
This game got alot more harder due to the update they did so here is some more updated stuff...

Music: The music soundtrack in Quarantine is repetitive and gets annoying after a while, this however doesn’t matter because at least in my case I would zone out and the music was just there.

Graphics: The game doesn’t take much to play and isn’t resource intensive. The only real difference between high and low quality is the sharpness of the gameplay and the framerate.

Gameplay: Let’s talk about this in two ways, release and now February 16, 2017.

Release:

•	The game was too easy and could easily be beaten with no strategy other than getting the medic as your starter and getting a certain trait that makes it so any city healed is 100% healed until re-infected by a nearby city. This strategy took easily about 8 game turns to achieve and the traits don’t cost any money.
•	The game didn’t take as much strategy to beat and really had no consequences. 
•	The diseases weren’t that potent and were laughable, I never loss at release.


February 16, 2017:

•	The game got an update and let’s just say it made the game a lot harder, they also moved the stronger traits around so it wasn’t so easy to abuse.
•	The game actually required strategy.
•	The diseases were very potent and spread relatively fast.

I now give this game:
6.5 / 10 Cabbages on the would Play Again Scale.
6 / 10 Cabbages on the Price Scale.
7 / 10 Cabbages on the Difficulty Scale

author: {'steamid': '76561198060762238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1500140866}
review:
[i]I play games for a living and get all of them for free, it doesn't affect my judgement[/i]
This is one of those reasonably polished low on content early access games that have a good foundation for a ton of game content. For now it is not very in depth and you can relatively quickly figure out the "formula" to succeed every time but it is fun and still requires thinking and planning each turn.

I'm looking forward to future updates and I'll definitely follow the development, it has potential to be a very time consuming turn based game with very interesting mechanics and theme. For now it has about 5-6h of fun plus 10-20 hours of just playing for the sake of playing (turn based players will understand what I mean)

author: {'steamid': '76561198274600645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1486664236}
review:
简单说说，题材不错，策略还行，但是发挥一般。勉强好评。
说点缺点吧：还是太简单，疾病的传染路径一目了然，染病中心城市隔离，疾病就基本传播不出去。还有，居然没有死亡概念，有点太悠闲，没有紧迫感，全人类感染就gameover，也太随意了，感染到死亡还是有过程的，特别是增加各种措施以后。最后，游戏结束，各种统计也没有，成就感全无。
PS:推荐部电影《末日之战》

author: {'steamid': '76561198078642178', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1486736671}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197998408431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1492262101}
review:
Finished all medium scenarios and one hard scenario. Currently game is playable, there are not bugs or glitches or technical issues. All major gameplay mechanisms are already implemented (research, upgrades, quarantines, spread, cure, recruit, finance), but at this moment the game becomes repetitve very qucikly. I'd love to see more actions (maybe political stabilization, because diplomat is useless), the game would benefit from some tradeoffs (sent your agent for one turn to do fundraising or send back to the lab or gather more samples to speed up the research). Currently tactical layer is interesting but obvious (I started to think about variants maybe three times on hard scenario). 

Graphic works well, text descriptions (agent bios and random events) add flavour. I'd love more stat element in agents and in regions. 

At this moment the game is slightly overpriced for the lack of content, but enjoyable and rather interesting. I do look forward for the final release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212834795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1493553176}

author: {'steamid': '76561198153833485', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1598504763}
review:
Nice idea, yet with dreadful details. I would like to give a few suggestions.

1. Please show a warning if I haven't starting any research when I press 'next round'.
2.Different agents are actually nearly the same after a few rounds. Some of there abilities are getting more and more useless. For instance, a doctor can heal up to 5 points, but each city only got 4. Maybe there could learn some ultra skills after reaching the top level.
3. Earth is a globe, so diseases may move through Bering Straits from North America to Asia. I found North America the garden of Eden, natuarly isolated form the outside world. And since Australia is so far from South Africa, it is a little untrue to see they been linked.

Ps, thank you very much for well Chinese translating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198221065300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1494929770}
review:
Please check the feedback in English at the bottom if necessary. (Updated at 14th, May, 2017)

2017年5月14日更新：

埃博拉病毒已经更新了一段时间，今天花打了5把（2次普通，3次困难，包括埃博拉在内的3种病毒）。经过了2个小时的战斗后，我觉得这款游戏值得对该题材感兴趣的玩家试试了。

在经历了几次版本调整吼，现在的游戏进程确实称得上是「战斗」了。我无法再无脑取胜，而是得斟酌隔离、治疗、研制解药的时机，以及针对性地挑选特工。下面我挑几个前后变化较大的感受说说。

虽然先前提出的一些问题没能彻底解决，比如4大类科技仍然有强有弱，但已经呈现了明显的选择价值。换句话说，不再是无所谓的设置了。直奔「消毒」而去不再是唯一选择，基本只会完成在游戏后期的「消毒」并不能让你力挽狂澜。而在中期尽快获得招募第5位特工的权限也有不小的收益。

如果我没搞错的话，特工的基础属性增加了，变成了1）移动能力+2）生命值。这个改动的效果很明显：如果要肉厚的特工，那就脚短，加上出生地一定是总部，很有可能陷入总是比疾病传播慢一步的尴尬境地；而要想高机动性，那就皮薄，虽然14%的行动扣血率不高，但在中后期高强度的行动下，花费行动机会回血或是减员都会明显增加压力。

隔离和治疗差别化了，在对付高传染性的病毒（如细菌）时隔离的作用很明显。因为隔离需要花钱，而这也让钱变得更有价值了（不像2月时候的那个版本，中后期根本不缺钱）。

这些调整都在细处，并非一蹴而就。感谢开发组。


--------------------------------------------（2月17日EA版本的测评见下）-----------------------------
现有的教程和3种病毒模式都打完了，前三把打的是普通难度，最后一把困难难度。耗时 106 分钟。以目前的完成度，48元有些贵了。以同样48元的《瘟疫公司》为标准，本作的游戏内容目前大概只有它的 20% 左右。

[h1]简评：美术和UI都挺不错，动画卡顿感略强。玩法上需要再好好打磨、深挖、丰富。[/h1]

#最大的问题在于游戏体验一马平川，没有什么高潮点。#

直觉上来说，这 100 多分钟的游戏没有给我什么快感，哪怕是困难难度，赢了也有什么成就感。[b]这是难度设计的问题，我认为是游戏发展的可能性不够丰富所致。更具体一点，可能是疾病特点和事件设计不足所致。[/b]我选择的行动方案是[spoiler]外交官或者医疗兵开局，拉赞助、出医疗兵、最快招募满人手。治疗疾病优先控制疫情，其次节流阻止传播。没了，然后就等通关，一般20回合以内结束游戏，而且中期开始就是没有压力的等待实验完成、攻克疾病。[/spoiler][b]不同疾病之间差异几乎感觉不出来。[/b]

[b]策略游戏的核心乐趣之一是有意义的选择（meaningful choice）[/b]——我想试着以此为基础，从 3 方面来谈谈本作EA版本（2017年2月10日）的不足：游戏提供的选择、获胜途径、游戏体验（操作反馈）。

[h1]简单明了的游戏元素[/h1]

4 种特工：外交官、士兵、医疗兵、科研人员各 2 名可供招募。
5 种行动：拉赞助点、治疗特工、隔离、采集样本、治疗疾病，每个特工每回合可以进行 1 次行动。
实验：选一部分病症进行攻克，需要一定数量的样本。
强化：选择一项强化进行研究，种类分别是加强特工生存能力、疾病治疗效果、经济/招募能力、特工治疗效果。

这里我没有明显不满，唯一需要吐槽的是：就目前的游戏版本而言，开局第一回合应该就是拉赞助，而中期来看，升级的收益也不太明显，所以起始带哪个特工这个选择几乎没有意义。

[h1]没有高潮的游戏流程[/h1]

游戏中，治疗疾病的收益最低是 1，而疫病的活动增值好像是每回合 3，所以 3 位特工就能很好地控制疾病状况。偶尔突发事件，只要兵种齐全，基本都能过。即便是看起来最糟糕的城市失守，也不会给余下的游戏进程造成太大影响。

在游戏的过程中，赞助早期很快就拉满，而特工只要不掉血就没必要治疗，而剩下的 3 个选项中有两个都可以控制疫情，随便选哪个都足以应对。[b]疫情的危险程度威胁不到战术选择。[/b]

至于强化研究则是有些鸡肋，似乎怎么选都不会影响游戏走向（治疗完成的城市不再染病或许算是一个过于强大的选择），而是不是要花钱加快研究速度，也没什么存在感。[b]其他地方不用钱了，才会投这里。[/b]这也引出了另外一个问题：虽然有经济系统，但几乎不需要管理，或者说过于简易了。

[h1]茫然的决策过程[/h1]

本作的决策过程相当寡淡。作为策略游戏，我希望能体验到分析信息、作出决策的挑战，和面对突发情况的刺激。在游戏中，行动的成功率虽然体现为风险的「高、中、低、无」，然而哪怕风险再高，似乎也只是特工扣血，所以只要特工不死，行动就一定能得到预期收益。再加上行动词数只和特工数量有关，游戏难度其实就相当低了。与此同时，做选择又没有明显的反馈差异，虽然看似能做的选择不止一个，但其实哪一个选择都没什么趣味。

关于突发事件，没有标明各个选择的消耗、可能的后果，只有单纯的「风险高、中、低」以及所需特工种类，感觉就像是在 galgame 里选送什么礼物给妹子一样——选啥都行。没有意义。

---------------------------------------------------Updated at 14th, May, 2017---------------------------------------------
There has been some time since the addition of the disease of Ebola. After spending aound 2 hours on fighting for 5 times (2 in noraml mode, 3 in difficult mode), I feel it's the time to recommend the game.

After several iterations, the game process can be taken as 'fighting' now. I cannot wait for win any more, I need to think carefully when to isolate, heal, or develop a cure. Additionally, the selection of agents play a role in the gaming.

Then I will pick up some primary differences between the current version and the version of I reviewed in Feb. to talk. 

1. Although no all problems mentioned before have been solved, e.g. there are still obvious gaps between the technologies, there are meaningful differences among some of them. In other words, the choice of techology matters. It is not the only way to go straightway to 'disinfection', finishing it dosen't mean you will win in a late stage of game. E.g. it is also valuable to get the right to hire the 5th agent in the middle of gaming.

2. If I was correct, agents has an additional attribute: mobility. This addtion means we need to make a decision between HP and mobility depended on the situation. The power in HP means the weakness in mobility. An agent with higher HP can work effectively in intensive actions without consuming a round to self-heal. However, they might not be able to take the infection under control, especially when you face a highly infectious disease (e.g. bacterium). Although 14% possibility of being injured seems low, consuming a round to self-heal or losing an agent can increase the pressure markedly in the later stage.

3. The differentiation between 'isolation' and 'heal' is clear and 'isolation' become more effective to infection control. This makes money better, because 'isolation' needs money. It is an obvious change, you didn't have to worry about money in the version of Feb. 2017.

All these improvements are resulted from the efforts in tuning, which cannot be achieved easily. Thanks for the developers. Good job. Looking forward to the following development.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I have played all available content including the tutorial in 106 mins, the first 3 of them are in Normal mode and the last one in Difficult mode. For this version (EA at the 10th of Feb. in 2017) I think the price is not so acceptable (comparing to Plague Inc. with the same price).

Briefly, the art and UI are good, but it would be better if the animation/ game process become more fluent. The problem is the gameplay, which needs to be polished, deepened, and expanded more.

The biggest point is that, the experience is dull. I was looking forward to feeling some excitements.

I could hardly have a sence of achievement in the 100 mins, even if I was in the difficult mode. It seems like the process of game is monotonous, lacking of changes or varieties. Specifically, the diseases and events are not able to influence my playing. I always follow the steps in game: setting up funding, getting a medic, filling my team as soon as possible; taking diseases under control, and stopping cities from infection. Then I just need to wait for a win. Generally, I will win in 20 turns and there is no pressure after the first 10 turns I guess. 

I could hardly see the difference between diseases.

There are some choices or settings I found boring below:
1. No matter which agent you choose to begin a game, it doesn't matter.
2. Any disease will infect 3 people each turn, then the game would be too easy to be fun after you get 3 agents.
3. Events never affect my strategy, even my plan.
4. Worthless research speeding up (I only invest in this part when there is nothing else I can spend the fund.) This may imply the economy system is too simple.
5. Information is not enought. Too much of my choices depend on randomness and there is no information for me to consider carefully with my move.

It could be better as well if the narrative is enhanced.

Looking forward to the following development. Good luck!
-----------------
As for the translations, 'credits' in the menu should be understood as the develop team or the praise for relevant staff rather than the points a player get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090643758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1487083190}
